column4: I have a laptop with a ati 9600 pro card and I am not able to install ubuntu using the live CD, so I installed via alternative CD. Now once I login I have no video
can anyone help me out at all?
are you running the mobility or PCI/AGP version of the card?
hello?
Sager laptop?
What driver are you using in your /etc/X11/xorg.conf file?
run "sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf" Look for a Section "Device" and tell us what driver it is using
you can boot into single user mode to log in via a terminal , and bypassing X
driver is set to ATI
it should
if you want to run the binrary you could type "dpkg -l | grep fglrx" to see if you have the fglrx driver installed, you could also try "fglrx" as the driver
although it has some problems with the 9600 card
especially if you have two monitors (the mouse ont he second monitor shows up as a square box)
it probably isn't a fault of Ubuntu, it probably is that your Xorg config needs to be updated
Xorg has changed from 6.8 to 6.9 to 7.0 to 7.1 with each ubuntu release
did changing to "radeon" work?
after it *fails*, do a "less /var/log/Xorg.0.log"
search for "EE" by typing a slash "/" and then EE
use the 'n' key to find th enext match
there is a chance your Xorg config is just wrong or has an error in it.
if thats the case you'll have to eidt it, and not just rely on "ubuntu updates"
